Message.Msg: These are the latest valuations using the dividend discount model and EPS and 5-year growth rates from Yahoo! Finance, a 10% discount rate, and a 0% growth rate starting in Year 6. Message.Title: Trendline Charts to help you screen trending stocks!
Message.Msg: This is a great app if you are into trading stocks and technical analysis. Most of stock charting programs let you see price movements and technical indicators, but you have to draw trendlines by hand. None other apps or programs does automatic trendline analysis. Trendline Charts does! not only that, it is also a screener that scans the whole market and find list of stocks that match certain trendline patterns, such as Channels, resistance breakout, Wedge etc... Check it out at Google Play: Trendline Charts:

Message.Title: Is Android for poor people?
Message.Msg: Android has 72% of the smartphone market vs. iPhone's 15%, but these numbers are exactly flipped for profits. Apple has 72% of the profits, while Android smartphone makers have only 15%! Basically, Android is for the same sort of people who require food stamps and Medicaid, if you get my drift. They have a "smartphone," but they have no clue what it's actually used for and practically never buy any apps, click on any ads, do any searches, or do anything commercial on it. In other words, Android's 72% market share is meaningless, because its target market--food stamp recipients--is perennially unprofitable. It's not a good business model to target poor people and food stamp recipients who buy Androids not for apps but because Androids are just cheaper than iPhones. Such price-sensitive people are the people least likely to purchase apps as well. From a a commerical standpoint, then, Android phones are no different from the cheap clam-shaped feature phones that they have largely replaced for the poor masses. They aren't even treated as smartphones by the people who own them (just like "Smart TVs" aren't actually used as smart TVs by those who purchase them). Sure, some geeks actually use Android phones and think they're great, but the average Joe isn't a geek and geeks don't make up the mass market.

Message.Title: Google 's bad 2012 Quarter!
Message.Msg: “Chitikia’s statistics are bad for Microsoft, but they aren’t much better for Google,” Shanklin reports. “The Nexus 7 and 10 combined for over seven times the web traffic of Surface. That sounds good at first, but it still only makes up about 1% of tablet web traffic. The iPad continues to dominate, with 88% of all tablet web traffic.”
